artist: Jan van de Velde, Claes Janz. Visscher II
creditline: The Mary and Robyn Campbell Fund for Art Books
inscription: handwriting in graphite inside front cover (in Dutch?): ... ex.coll. H.E. TEN CATE; handwriting inside back cover (mostly erased)
markings: handwritten in brown ink on title page: 60 paisages de Vandevelde; many etchings with stamp: JV
portfolio:
Ameissimae Aliquot Regiunculae [Some of the most beautiful regions]
Five complete or nearly complete sets of 12 landscapes each.
text: This vellum bound volume contains landscape etchings, mostly of the flat, watery Dutch terrain but with more Italianate imagery occasionally mixed in. The cover bears a faded inscription in French: Paisages de / Vande Velde. The edges of the pages are dyed light red. There are 59 prints in the volume, arranged into five sets, each with its own title page. The images are mostly pastoral and agricultural with many dilapidated buildings. Each of the landscapes is peopled with tiny figures.
title: Album of landscape etchings
